name: Who's Your Daddy
description: Who's Your Daddy is a casual 1 on 1 video game featuring a clueless father attempting to prevent his infant son from certain death.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP 64 Processor: 2 GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce 460/Radeon HD 5850/Intel HD 4600 with at least 1024 MB video RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Youtubers made it look fun. What I played was a disgrace.
This is very competitive game that should be in tournaments  5/5

Friend bought this for me, fun while it works but nowhere near a 'release' version. Badly optimized and numerous glitches prevent playing for more than a couple games at a time.  I know it's a joke game but at least try to keep it playable. Will update this review if the game is patched.  EDIT: So the patch fixed the rematch bug, and the game seems to run smoother overall. Only had a few minutes to play it so I'm not sure if it's entirely 'fixed'.  Review should now be considered a tentative recommendation (But since I can't choose that I'll stick with 'Not Recommended'). If you're looking at reviews chances are you're on the fence, and I still don't think it's quite worth the price of admission unless you already have a friend or two to play with.  tl;dr if you're looking at reviews to make a purchase chances are you can safely pass this game up, it's exactly what the trailers/screenshots look like and if you want that go ahead and buy it, but don't expect anything else.
This game is probably better than cod infinite warfare

I've enjoyed playing this game a lot up until the most recent updates which broke a few things. Mainly:  - Items no longer drop where mouse is aiming and instead drop at your feet (which makes placing baby gates and putting dangerous items up on shelves next to impossible) - When daddy is able to pick up baby he can then drop it outside map or in walls so it is stuck - Daddy can use the smoke detector battery multiple times to get all powerups immediately (more than ~5 and game crashes) - Cooking for baby chore is broken and instead now grants the powerup that nuke the pills gives - The new animals defecate 2x every time they defecate (which is a lot) which makes it next to impossible to keep away from baby - Pets go through walls to get to you even if you lock them in a room or outside - Baby STILL cannot drown after taking off the inflatable ring (old bug that still hasn't been addressed) - Custom games with more than 2 players often has everybody vanish/disconnect silently (another old bug still unfixed)  I've been waiting a few weeks to see if any of these bugs would be addressed, however there hasn't even been any acknowledgement of the bugs (that I've seen) let alone any fixes. Until this and quite a few other bugs mentioned in the other reviews are fixed, I would hold off buying to see if the devs are going to commit to fixing these issues or if they are leaving it as is.  Recommendation for devs: Put a pause on adding new features for now and concentrate on fixing bugs.  Also recommend: Have baby/daddy role switch every round when you are paired up with someone from match-making.
This game is broken. why release it as full when it clearly isn't. When we play a game we can't do a rematch, the game just freezes until one person leaves.

♥ It isn't hard to run.   This is something I deeply appreciate because though my computer is on the higher end, it can struggle to run games like Minecraft or TF2, and I like to not hear my computer wheezing and coughing like it's going to die.   I'm not sure how it would run on a laptop but I'd imagine it would be fine on a lower end or low graphics computer! : D  ♥ I like how you change roles.  There are some games that I find boring when you're stuck playing as one character or the other for the entire game time. However with Who's Your Daddy, you switch places each round, playing as the baby or the daddy then vice versa. This way it helps to mix up the game play!   ♥ Playing this was so entertaining.  During the short time that I played, it cracked me up to no end. I love how dark the game is yet how amusing it is at the same time. I appreciate games that know not to take themselves seriously. For sure a must play if you're having a bad day or want to have some silly fun with a friend.   ✘ The number one problem with this game is my motion sickness.  When I played with my friend, I felt horrendously sick and have been unable to play it again. This is far from the dev team's fault however I thought to include it in my review for others who suffer from motion sickness. If you do, be warned that this game may be hard on you.   ✘ The graphics could be better.  It doesn't matter that much to me - it's a game to have fun in, not a game to be impressed by the graphics, or spend time staring at how realistic the floor looks. I do think that the baby looks terribly creepy...I'll let him get into the cleaner, LOL.   Of course I'm not serious about that.    ✘ It isn't a game to play with your friend if you aren't going to use your mics.  I played this game while skyping with my friend. If you were going to spend time texting/messaging, there would be no way - you either play the game or chat! By using your mics, you can still chat and have fun.  Overall I absolutely suggest this game for people looking for fun co-op/multiplayer games!!
I have never wanted to kill my self more!!!!!!!!!

When i see this game on youtube, it looks extremely fun to play and not glitchy at all. But, when i play with my friends we are all lagging and teleporting about no matter how well our internet is going, we cannot really play as we cannot interact with things and everything glitches out.

I loved the idea and concept of the game and it is a fun game with friends. However from what i could play it was full of glitches and issues with picking up items and using them, also the baby can win the game in less than a minute with no easy way to stop it.  If the developers wish to improve they must start with making sure items can be correctly picked up and used. At this current time i would not be spending money on it.

The release update has its ups and downs. First of all, I personally like the music and second of all, it's quite a big update and it was probably rushed from all the people shouting (On the comments) at the developer. There are the problems like the pink screen, which me and my friend don't have. The baby can't win though and the evil tortilla screen lingers for a while with my friends game. It is very fun but i think it needs to have an update that fixes the bugs and incomplete parts of the game. Also you can only spectate as the baby when you die, and i thought it was with family gathering but i think it happened with original. You can't escape either as dad when the baby dies. When i joined a server it would stay on the wierd thing showing the rooms and i couldn't press escape.  So my overall review for this is= It's a great game but it needs to be fixed, I love the graphics because that makes the game what it is, and if the developer fixed them, then it wouldnt be as funny. Please fix this game, though. But i'm not going to rush the dev because he's just released the full game and i imagine that was rushed, Thankyou for reading this.
super funny, needs way more work on the glitches and bugs, visuals.

The duties of a game dad usually entail smashing in the teeth of anyone so much as looks at your daughter figure, but Who’s Your Daddy takes a far more realistic approach. The two-player asymmetric multiplayer game will have a game dad rushing about trying to child-proof a home while the baby crawls about trying to find ways to injure itself. Drinking soap is always a safe bet, and maybe you can pop yourself in the oven. Oh sure, the game looks all sorts of janky, but it’s a charming idea. [7/10]

Honestly one of the best games to kill time and laugh till your sides hurt with friends. There are so many things to do:  -Set yourself on fire -Drink bleach (for the memes) -Drink soap -Drown yourself -Eat glass -Freeze yourself -and so much more!  This game is constantly making BIG updates and there is always a surprise when you see it downloading something new! Whether it's new ways to end your miserable baby life, more places to hide after drinking bleach, or even customizing your miserable self before you pass on, this game is always adding fun stuff.  Let's be real, for its price, this game really makes up for it. I'd only recommend that to truly enjoy it to it's fullest, that you play it with a friend.   11/10 Drinking bleach and eating glass with my friends has never been so fun daddy~

I'd rather a game take 3 more months to come out than come out so terribly done it's unplayable.

Started out as the father. Turned my TV on. Watched my baby jump out of his crib and climb up the chair in his room to get to the ceiling. Ran into the room as my baby went into the air vent. He came out of the air vent into the closet downstairs, as I ran downstairs and opened the door, I watched my baby chug bleach and detergent, start turning green, and with its head turned upwards to become flat with its body, turn into a satanic demon child as it sprinted into my kitchen and started eating batteries that were under the sink as I was helpless to stop it.  10/10, would let satan child drink bleach again   Overall, a poorly modeled (in a great way, it's made in Unity, but it really adds to the character and style of the game) but fantastic game. It's very fun and even challenging at times, and it's interesting to see the endless ways that your baby tries to kill itself and the unlimited fun you can have trying to stop it (or even being the baby yourself). Not to mention, this game is hilarious. I mean HILARIOUS. My friends and I couldn't stop laughing while playing this game.  If you can, get the game now. One of the most fun games I've played yet.

i really wish i could give the game a positive review, as i love the concept, and was so excited to play it with my friends. yet the game, at the current state it is in, is damnnear unplayable..  cons: -very buggy and glitchy. -poorly optimized. -matchmaking is average at best. -playing as the baby is very over-powered. -framerate is painfully low when playing as the baby. -framerate is painfully low in general. -music is not good at all, and often is overlapped by other tracks.  pros: -hilarious concept. -great character models. -THE ABILITY TO REFUND.  if the developer decides to give us a good update, then i will change my opinion on the game. but for the time being, do not purchase this broken, unfinished mess.

Bought this game in hopes it would give me some tips on fathering my newborn son, Kyler. After completing the 'Who's Your Daddy' program and receiving my Good Daddy Diploma I can say with certainty that the system works. The other night I caught Kyler eating out of the trash can and my Daddy instincts immediately kicked in. By feeding him a full bottle of Pills, I saved little Kyler's life. I would never have came up with that solution on my own, before playing this simulation. Recommended for any new parent or babysitter.

Very fun and addicting game. WOuld recommend this to anyone who wants a good goofy game to play. But be warned, it may be laggy at first but it goes away. Loved every minute of this game.  What I loved about this game is the types of games you can play in this. I perfer Daddy's Nightmare than the others, with the fact that you can kill Daddy as the Baby. The death animation is funny and the music always makes the game hilarious, but all the game modes are great.  Really worth the $4.99 price. I would highly recommend this to anyone to play. I'm definately looking forward to what comes next. I give this game Four out of Five Stars. With good graphic, good funny music, and fun game modes, Who's Your Daddy is one of the best cheap games I played. If they add a story mode to the game, then this will get better.

I've played 9 hours of this game, and although it may not seem like alot, I have played it enough to know all the secrets.  I'm just going to write a basic pros and cons review.  Pros:  - Fun Gameplay - constant updates - lots of ways to die - Family Gathering mode - do not need to host servers to play multiplayer - The bugs and glitches can easily be avoided if you know how. - The game is PLAYABLE again! - **If you open mom's 'secret drawer,' you might be able to find some kind of strange rubber object.**  Cons: - lots and lots of bugs - some people online don't play the game properly - somewhat disturbing concept   Overall, If you are not too squeamish about a baby trying to kill himself, then I would get this game. Definetly worth it's price of 5$ as of now. This is a fun game to play for hours at a time.

If these problems were solved I would be playing this all the time with my friends! Hope you work out the bugs! Good job!

The game started off great. There was a baby and a daddy, and although it was slightly easier for the baby to win, the daddy could still win with a little practice. Then the steam release came. It was slightly harder to win as daddy, but still pretty easy if you knew what you were doing. Then an update came. It got slightly easier to win as baby, and harder as daddy. Then another update came. The daddy got some nice features to make it more balanced, and the baby got some more features to make it more unbalanced. Then another update came. The daddy got a helpful item and the baby could teleport. Then another update came. It started to become so unbalanced that if you joined a game and weren't daddy, you would leave with no thaught. Then another update came. The only real way to play became creating rules for your own game such as no forks in outlets. Then another update came.. A few toys were added making it practically impossible to complete the toy mission Then another update came.. It was slightly harder for the daddy to win and slightly easier for the baby Then another update came.. It was slightly harder for the daddy to win and slightly easier for the baby Then another update came... It was slightly harder for the daddy to win and slightly easier for the baby Every update, it's slightly harder for the daddy to win and slightly easier for the baby Every update It is now literally impossible to win as daddy unless you are increadibly experienced and the other player has never played.  Please, don't buy this game now.
